definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)

sentences.english: Mr ElBaradei has been asked by opposition groups to negotiate with the authorities on forming a national unity government.
sentences.chinese: 反对派请求巴拉迪去和当局者就组成联合政府谈判。

sentences.english: The referendum lock installed by the coalition is real;
sentences.chinese: 公投保险锁真真正正的被联合政府装了上去。

sentences.english: Among the commentariat, the world-weary view of Britain's new coalition government is that it cannot last.
sentences.chinese: 有部分媒体悲观地认为，英国的新联合政府无法长久。

sentences.english: Finally, the exigencies of coalition have been a burden.
sentences.chinese: 最后，联合政府的急切需要成为了负担。

sentences.english: A change in currency at the recommendation of the US-Chinese government.
sentences.chinese: 眼下建议成立中美联合政府。

sentences.english: Mr Ghannouchi has said a new coalition government could be announced on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 加努希表示，周一将宣布组建新的联合政府。

sentences.english: HSBC Kailuan of a coalition government set up temporary offices in the stinking puddles .
sentences.chinese: 丰滦密联合政府的办公地点临时设在臭水坑。

sentences.english: The Conservative-led coalition government is more diplomatic.
sentences.chinese: 外交手段越来越为由保守党领导的联合政府所青睐。

sentences.english: Whoever wins the contest will be faced with forming a coalition government.
sentences.chinese: 无论谁当选，都将面临组成一个联合政府。

sentences.english: Mr Cameron’s coalition government is at least as ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 起码，卡梅隆先生的联合政府是有志于此的。

sentences.english: The judges also took on record an affidavit submitted by the Union government.
sentences.chinese: 法官也尊奉了联合政府递交的一份宣誓书。

sentences.english: The loss of the MQM's support for the coalition opens up the possibility of its collapse.
sentences.chinese: 失去统一民族运动党的支持意味着联合政府可能瓦解。

sentences.english: It also suggested a new joint administration for Abyei.
sentences.chinese: 它还要求阿卜耶伊建立新的联合政府。

sentences.english: The charges were brought as the unity government held its first cabinet meeting.
sentences.chinese: 被指控的联合政府举行了第一次内阁会议。

sentences.english: Now it oversees austerity, the lodestar of the coalition government.
sentences.chinese: 如今它监视财政紧缩，这正是联合政府的目标。

sentences.english: In some localities a democratic coalition government of the local nationalities may be established first.
sentences.chinese: 有些地方也可以先成立地方民族民主联合政府。
